description: Demolition of existing office building and redevelopment to provide circa 15,903 square metres (GIA) of B1a office floorspace with associated car parking, motor-cycle parking, bicycle parking and bus shuttle service drop off provided at ground and basement level and with associated landscaping at ground level incorporating repaving and planting.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - No development other than demolition works shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted therewith (drawing no?s: F0001 Rev P1, F0002 Rev P1 and F0100 Rev P1 received 27/01/2016; F0101 Rev P1, F0102 Rev P1, F0103 Rev P1, F0104 Rev P1, F0105 Rev P1, F0200 Rev P1, F0201 Rev P1, F0202 Rev P1, F0300 Rev P1, D1251 Rev P1, D1252 Rev P1, D1300 Rev P1 and D1301 Rev P1 received 28/01/2016; D1099 Rev P4, D1100 Rev P4, D1101 Rev P4, D1102 Rev P2, D1103 Rev P2, D1104 Rev P2, D1105 Rev P2, D1106 Rev P2, D1107 Rev P3, D1150 Rev P2, D1160 Rev P3, D1200 Rev P2, D1201 Rev P2 and D1202 Rev P3 received 30/06/2016; Design, Heritage & Access Statement Addendum received 30/06/2016; Energy and Sustainability Statement received 06/05/2016) and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the buildings are occupied.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provision of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), or any order revoking or re-enacting that order, the premises shall be used for a B1a use class and for no other purpose (including any change of use to residential via the prior approval process).
Condition : 5 - No plumbing or pipes, other than rainwater pipes, shall be fixed to the external faces of buildings or associated structures.

Condition : 6 - No development other than demolition works shall take place until a landscaping scheme, including hard and soft landscaping, street furniture and lighting not affixed to buildings, illustrated on detailed drawings (in accordance with the general provisions shown on and off site on drawing no. D1150 Rev P2), has been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. Soft landscaping details shall include the planting of trees and shrubs showing species, type of stock, numbers of trees and shrubs to be included, and show areas to be grass seeded or turfed, planter profiles. Hard landscaping details shall include all ground surfaces, seating, lighting of all external public areas, refuse disposal points and designated smoking areas, together with finished ground levels and site wide topographical levels. All approved landscaping details shall be carried out in accordance with a timescale to be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority, and shall be maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority for a period of ten years. Such maintenance shall include the replacement within the next planting season of any plants/trees that die, or are severely damaged, seriously diseased, or removed, with another plant/tree of the same species and size as that originally planted unless the local planning authority gives its written consent to any variation.

Condition : 7 - The approved refuse and recycling store as shown on drawing no. D1100 Rev P4 shall be made available for use prior to the use of the development commencing and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 8 - The development hereby permitted shall only be operated in accordance with a Waste Management Strategy to be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority prior to the use of the development commencing.

Condition : 9 - No development other than demolition works shall take place until full details (including manufacturers specifications) of the cycle parking facilities (for not less than 146 bicycles) for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall conform to current guidance such as the TfL London Cycling Design Standards in design and layout and be fully implemented and be made available for use before the first occupation of the building hereby approved and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 10 - No development other than demolition works shall take place until a drainage strategy detailing any on and/or off site drainage works has been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority in consultation with the sewerage undertaker. This strategy shall include: Runoff volumes associated with the site for both pre and post development; detailed drainage designs and maintenance plan (this plan needs to include the maintenance activity for each type of drainage feature proposed, the frequency of the maintenance and who will be maintaining it); calculations to confirm the drainage scheme proposed will not cause any flooding up to and including the 1 in 30 year return period and that any flooding will be safely contained on site for return periods between the 1 in 30 and the 1 in 100 years. No discharge of foul or surface water from the site shall be accepted into the public system until the drainage works referred to in the strategy have been completed.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the first occupation of the building hereby approved, evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the National Calculation Method) to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy and Sustainability Statement (or any subsequent approved revisions) shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 13 - No development other than demolition works shall take place until a Delivery and Service Plan has been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The Plan shall demonstrate clear vehicle swept paths. The development shall only be completed in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 14 - No development other than demolition works shall take place until details of an integrated scheme of public art on the Burlington Lane/south-east elevation of the building (as indicatively shown on page 6 of the Design, Heritage & Access Statement Addendum) has been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. Further details of its future maintenance shall also submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The artwork shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the building, and thereafter maintained in accordance with the agreed details.

Condition : 15 - Within three months of construction works (other than demolition works) starting on site, a BREEAM Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an ?Excellent? (minimum score 70%) rating will be achieved.
Prior to first occupation of the building hereby approved, a BREEAM Post-Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an ?Excellent? (minimum score 70%) rating has been achieved.

Condition : 16 - Before the development hereby permitted commences:
a. A contaminated land Phase 1 desk study report shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. Should the Phase 1 report recommend that a Phase 2 site investigation is required, then this shall be carried out and submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be investigated by a competent person to identify the extent and nature of contamination. The report should include a tiered risk assessment of the contamination based on the proposed end use of the site. Additional investigation may be required where it is deemed necessary.
b. A scheme for the decontamination of the site shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, unless otherwise confirmed by the Local Planning Authority that this is not required. The scheme shall account for any comments made by the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby permitted is first occupied. 

During the course of the development:
c. The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues.

Before the development is first brought into use:
d. The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Condition : 17 - Notwithstanding the details shown on drawing numbers D1099 Rev P4, D1100 Rev P4 and D1150 Rev P2, a ground and basement level parking layout for the site (maximum provision of 159 spaces with minimum of 20% of spaces installed with electric charging points and minimum of 10% spaces to have passive provision), to include a minibus drop-off point, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The parking layout shall be accompanied with vehicle tracking (cars and minibus) to show that vehicles can safely access the spaces provided and manoeuvre within the site. The parking layout shall only be implemented in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 18 - The disabled access platform lifts as shown on drawing numbers D1100 Rev P4 and D1101 Rev P4 shall be fully implemented and be made available for use before the first occupation of the building hereby approved and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 19 - Prior to the first occupation of the building hereby approved, the proposed modifications to the footway/kerbline adjacent to its south-west elevation, as shown on drawing no. D1100 Rev P4, shall be fully implemented in accordance with the approved layout and the surfacing details as approved by details submitted pursuant to condition no. 6.
